result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jennifer A. Putnam

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Criminal Case Settlement
with Elements attached

Cases 15CF286 & 15CM264 called together 1:19 pm [Clerk SH] (Cases were scheduled for STC)
[Reserve Judge Mac J. Davis presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Jennifer A. Putnam in court with Attorney David Zarwell. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Zarwell submits letter along with certificates and plea paperwork

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Miss Putnam waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Arraignment.
State files information; Arraignment:--service of Information admitted, reading waived--maximum penalties recited

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1-15CF286; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2-15CF286 and case 15CM264

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions as adopted on the criminal case settlement, which include:
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random drug and/or alcohol screening
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program, per Agent
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--Take all prescribed medications only as prescribed
--No possession of any hypodermic needles unless medically necessary and approved by agent
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $50 drug testing fee
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--No contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Recess: 1:35 pm
Status conference at 04-11-2016 01:15 pm

Cases 15CF286 & 15CM264 called together at 1:48 pm [Clerk SH]
Attorney David Zarwell in court. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jennifer A. Putnam not in court.  
Court reviews with parties that off-record Clerk informed the Court that Miss Putnam was taken off-site from House of Corrections for programming so is not available via video as planned
Atty Zarwell informs the Court that he spoke with Miss Putnam this morning and she indicated that she would like to enter a plea in these matters. She will be released on 3/29/16. Request matters be
set for plea/setencing on 3/31/16, shortly after her release. 
Court informs parties that 3/31/16 is not workable due to homicide trial currently set on that date; alternate date set
Court directs that writ does not need to be prepared for Miss Putnam's next appearance, but if for some reason her custody status does not change Atty Zarwell is to notify the court
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty Zarwell indicates that next hearing maybe should be set as STC with possibility of it becoming plea/sentencing
Court directs Atty Zarwell to contact Miss Putnam to inform her of today's proceedings
Recess: 1:52 pm 

NEXT: (1) Schedule STC (possible Plea/Sentencing)  4/11/16 at 1:15 pm - Send notices **Defendant should be out of custody - no need for writ**
State's with Cover Letter
Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection, with Fax Cover Sheet
Sent to Defendant (1) NOH for 1/20/16 PTC (2)NOH for 2/8/16 STC//sent to LKA (Defendant updated address on 12/2/15)

Cases 15CF286 & 15CM264 called together at 10:00 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Jennifer A. Putnam appears via video, in-custody, with Attorney David Zarwell, who appears in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient

BOTH CASES: Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
15CF286: Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 
15CM264: Pleas of "Not Guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by Defendant

15CF286: Court requires a $1500 signature bond, with conditions:

-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
-Take all prescribed medications as prescribed
-No possession of drug paraphernalia especially needles
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-Booking at JCSD 

15CM264: Court requires a $1000 signature bond, with conditions:
-No acts or threats of violence towards anyone
-No contact with Dale Fenner or presence at his residence
-Absolute sobriety meaning no alcohol or drugs
-Take all prescribed medications as prescribed
-No possession of drug paraphernalia especially needles
-Booking at JCSD
Recess: 10:07 am 

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 1/20/16 at 1:40 pm - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for at 2/8/16 at 1:30 pm - Send notices
Initial appearance at 12-18-2015 09:30 am
